Summary I’ve always intuitively gravitated towards surveying my audience – whether it be my family and friends before making a big decision, or my customers when developing new products or outlining marketing strategies. As a result, I’ve always focused on delivering impactful results, insightful findings and thoroughly-researched recommendations. 
 
I’m also curious by nature. I ask a lot of questions and like to think through how a scenario might play out. I like to make well-informed decisions, and I’m often the first person to ask “Is this what the market is demanding?” or “Have we asked our customers what they want?” As a result, I’m a firm believer in pragmatic marketing and the value of market research and competitive intelligence in product development and marketing. 
 
That being said, I’ve found the roles and companies I align with best are customer driven and curious by nature. In my last role, I learned the in’s and out’s of market and competitive intelligence and research. Before that, I was part of an innovative team in the B2B space doing product marketing and communications. Even in the days of my MBA, I focused on marketing strategy, industry analysis and communications. 
 
Functional Expertise: 
 
• Marketing & Communications 
• Relationship Building 
• Market Research 
• Industry Analysis 
• Product Marketing 
• Project Management 
• Marketing Strategy 
• GTM Development 
• Executive Presentations 
• Investigative Research 
 
 
Areas of Research & Expertise: 
 
• Marketing/Email CRM Solutions 
• SaaS Solutions & Modern IT Solutions for SMB, Medium & Enterprise Organizations 
• Data Analytics 
• Data Visualization & Business Intelligence Tools 
• Business Reporting  
• Cyber Security & Intelligence 
• Workplace Evolution & Technology 
• Endpoint & Gateway Protection
